bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nelson Rollin Burr (b. 1904, d. 1994), was a librarian and historian, relating to labor issues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A collection of ca. 1300 index cards containing quotations gleaned from selected American newspapers, 1827-1837, relating to labor issues. The major subject headings under which the cards are arranged are: strikes, anti bank movement, imprisonment for debt, women in industry, the American system, typographical societies, dignity of labor, workingmen's publications, education, mechanics' associations, mechanics' institutes, and mechanics' conventions. One section is on workers and politics; classified by state, this section concentrates most on Connecticut, Delaware, the District of Columbia, Massachusetts, New York, and Pennsylvania. Material from about fifty newspapers is found here, but with particular concentration on Niles Weekly Register, National Trades Union, Daily National Intelligencer, Delaware Gazette and American Watchman, Hartford Times, and New England Artisan.
